title: Im at a loss.
body:
How in the actual fuck, do i force bronze players to listen.

i legit just came out of a game that went like this in a progression.

Freelo - winnable - winnable if we farm up - unwinnable - now they are just toying with us.

The first warning sign was when my first death was to a 4 and fucking 0 tryndamere gank and 8 fucking minutes.

The second warning sign was when that same tryndamere was 9/0 literally 6 minutes later.

now even at that point, the game was winnable, all my fucktard team had to do, was listen to me when i fucking told them "stop engaging, and farm"

but nah, 2/8 rammus, 3/13 akali, 2/10 alistair, and 5/12 jinx? thats fucking fed, they can take on god himself, so they are gonna keep engaging because if it didnt work the last 48 times it will work this time.

I mean fuck, it doesnt help that i lose 21 lp everytime i get a shitstain team like this, thats 2 games that i have to win  to get back to the same lp.

And despite losing almost twice as much lp as i gain, i went up 2 divisions today, by carrying myself *gasp* and yet these fucking players still wont fucking listen.

So a psa to all you bronze fucking trash out there, when someone clearly fucking better than you, who is currently proving it mid fucking game, tells you to do something, just fucking do it, you clearly dont know what youre doing.

replies.body: honestly what it feels like on the daily
Get good and carry them 1v9 it's easy. If you can't carry them you're too bad to get out of bronze and if it seems impossible you have much to learn about the game

So if I'm not gold plus I'm not allowed to climb?

That's retarded.

If I can 1v9 that means I am not just better than bronze I'm better than silver.

Because to 1v9 you usually need to be about 2-3 tiers below your actual  true mmr.

The state I'm in is I'm visibly better than my current elo.

I could have a team that is unbeliebely meh, no one is good but no one fed either.

And guess what, I'll carry that game 9/10.

It's not until it becomes a 1v9 and I have to carry my own weight plus the deadweight of 4 feeders where I can't win a game by my own.

Unfortunately this is bronze somehow 90% of this Elo are feeders.
Statistically speaking if you perform better than the enemy counterpart your win ratio over a large sample size will be greater than 50% and you will therefore climb.

funny that i have 500 games played this season and... oh hey look, my winrate is greater than 50%.

have i proved im not meant to be here yet or do i need to keep winning till my winrates even higher? even though if i do that, ill still be fucking bronze, because for every loss, i need to win 2 games, to get an lp gain, therefore i literally cannot climb with a winrate below 75%

I mean fuck i was b1 with 80% winrate, i dont fucking belong in b5-b3

Well at least you can play knowing that the 5 enemy players are most likely just god awful as your dreaded teammates, assuming your claim is true.

So yeah, it's more about you making a difference and snowballing that into a victory.

But indeed, it actually takes quite amount of challenge to try and control the uncontrollable variables of the match, ie the teammates, and that definitely quite mount up to a significant frustration. However instead of ditching them and looking at them funny, a better approach is to simply go with and work around them instead of trying to forward your ideas and theirs be damned.

I think that's a far better approach and also gives the higher chance to win. But yeah, it's purely theoretical.

Still, the rank system absolutely has the element of grinding in-built into it, where many of the matches could be outright unwinnable and you're forced to even the field even though it's not technically your mistake or your own fault a lot of times. And similarly, one can also be given victories they didn't work for. So yeah, it depends on what you're looking for and what you can take really. For someone who's just out to have some general fun, they may not be too intrigued in the aspect of climbing ranked. So up to you.

And if you've decided to climb, then you will come to accept** the fact that you win some and you also lose some**. Just try your best playing with your team as the situation demands and hope for the best, is really the best way to go about it.

OR..........

You can 1 trick snowballers and solo win the game. But tbh, I don't recommend this kind of approach. You see, one of the biggest reason why the low elo is as chaotic as it is, is precisely due to this point, where everyone and their mother are trying to singlehandedly win the match. So yeah, don't do this.
you don't force them to listen. that's your fucking problem. you're trying to force them to do something.

Im trying to force them to not play like fuckwits.

Im not saying "if you dont take dragon right now im afking"

im saying "if you dont stop fucking throwing your lifeless corpse at that enemy ill afk"
